posts.text: The same way uber/lyft being popular in a city can drive up car prices and congestion, it's hardly a stretch to believe that short term rental services can drive up housing prices and undermine residential availability.

reply_context.text: Consider how ride sharing services like uber have been observed to increase traffic rather than reduce it. Gig economy services occupy capacity that was allocated for specific uses, reducing availability of resources in favor of servicing a different market than they were originally allocated for.
